<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 306, 220, 320]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 327, 358, 344]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Pure Mathematics 1 (P1)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 370, 418, 386]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 392, 460, 408]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 418, 390, 435]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 448, 787, 464]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name in the spaces at the top of this page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 464, 325, 479]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 479, 504, 495]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 495, 504, 510]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 510, 380, 525]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 540, 285, 555]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 555, 910, 586]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 586, 593, 601]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 601, 606, 616]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 630, 609, 646]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 646, 755, 661]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 661, 440, 676]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 75.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
The coefficients of \(x^{2}\) and \(x^{3}\) in the expansion of \((3 - 2x)^{6}\) are \(a\) and \(b\) respectively. Find the value of \(\frac{a}{b}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 95, 920, 113]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 712, 92]]<|/det|>
Relative to an origin \(O\), the position vectors of points \(A\) and \(B\) are given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[336, 98, 662, 145]]<|/det|>
\[\overrightarrow{OA} = \left( \begin{array}{c}3\\ -6\\ p \end{array} \right)\qquad \mathrm{and}\qquad \overrightarrow{OB} = \left( \begin{array}{c}2\\ -6\\ -7 \end{array} \right),\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 153, 299, 171]]<|/det|>
and angle \(AOB = 90^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 185, 156, 203]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 184, 316, 203]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(p\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 185, 918, 203]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 530, 411, 549]]<|/det|>
The point \(C\) is such that \(\overrightarrow{OC} = \frac{2}{3}\overrightarrow{OA}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 567, 153, 586]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 566, 500, 586]]<|/det|>
Find the unit vector in the direction of \(\overrightarrow{BC}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 567, 920, 586]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 78, 97, 97]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 77, 156, 96]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[161, 72, 303, 97]]<|/det|>
Prove the identity

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[303, 68, 544, 102]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{1 + \cos \theta}{\sin \theta} +\frac{\sin \theta}{1 + \cos \theta}\equiv \frac{2}{\sin \theta}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 78, 920, 97]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 78, 154, 96]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 71, 751, 103]]<|/det|>
Hence solve the equation \(\frac{1 + \cos \theta}{\sin \theta} + \frac{\sin \theta}{1 + \cos \theta} = \frac{3}{\cos \theta}\) for \(0^\circ \leqslant \theta \leqslant 360^\circ\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 78, 920, 97]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 99, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 75, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
An arithmetic progression has a first term of 32, a 5th term of 22 and a last term of \(-28\). Find the sum of all the terms in the progression.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
Each year a school allocates a sum of money for the library. The amount allocated each year increases by \(2.5\%\) of the amount allocated the previous year. In 2005 the school allocated \(\)2000. Find the total amount allocated in the years 2005 to 2014 inclusive.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 103, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 420, 92]]<|/det|>
The equation of a curve is \(y = 2\cos x.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 104, 156, 123]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 104, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
Sketch the graph of \(y = 2\cos x\) for \(-\pi \leqslant x \leqslant \pi\), stating the coordinates of the point of intersection with the \(y\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 574, 757, 596]]<|/det|>
Points \(P\) and \(Q\) lie on the curve and have \(x\)-coordinates of \(\frac{1}{3}\pi\) and \(\pi\) respectively.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 609, 153, 626]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 607, 549, 626]]<|/det|>
Find the length of \(PQ\) correct to 1 decimal place.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 606, 920, 625]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 756, 92]]<|/det|>
The line through \(P\) and \(Q\) meets the \(x\)-axis at \(H(h, 0)\) and the \(y\)-axis at \(K(0, k)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 106, 154, 123]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 104, 485, 123]]<|/det|>
Show that \(h = \frac{5}{9}\pi\) and find the value of \(k\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 106, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
The horizontal base of a solid prism is an equilateral triangle of side \(x \mathrm{cm}\). The sides of the prism are vertical. The height of the prism is \(h \mathrm{cm}\) and the volume of the prism is \(2000 \mathrm{cm}^3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 121, 156, 140]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 121, 885, 141]]<|/det|>
Express \(h\) in terms of \(x\) and show that the total surface area of the prism, \(A \mathrm{cm}^2\), is given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[400, 147, 598, 180]]<|/det|>
\[A = \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2} x^2 + \frac{24 000}{\sqrt{3}} x^{-1}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 156, 920, 175]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 154, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 763, 92]]<|/det|>
Given that \(x\) can vary, find the value of \(x\) for which \(A\) has a stationary value.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 610, 191, 628]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 609, 779, 628]]<|/det|>
Determine, showing all necessary working, the nature of this stationary value.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 609, 920, 628]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 78, 92, 97]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 677, 102]]<|/det|>
A curve for which \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = 7 - x^2 - 6x\) passes through the point (3, \(-10\)).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 112, 156, 131]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 112, 405, 131]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the curve.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 114, 920, 133]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 73, 154, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 742, 92]]<|/det|>
Express \(7 - x^{2} - 6x\) in the form \(a - (x + b)^{2}\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 510, 193, 529]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 510, 734, 529]]<|/det|>
Find the set of values of \(x\) for which the gradient of the curve is positive.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 510, 920, 529]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[346, 87, 687, 291]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 308, 920, 358]]<|/det|>
In the diagram, \(OAXB\) is a sector of a circle with centre \(O\) and radius \(10\mathrm{cm}\). The length of the chord \(AB\) is \(12\mathrm{cm}\). The line \(OX\) passes through \(M\), the mid-point of \(AB\), and \(OX\) is perpendicular to \(AB\). The shaded region is bounded by the chord \(AB\) and by the arc of a circle with centre \(X\) and radius \(XA\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 369, 156, 388]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 369, 690, 388]]<|/det|>
Show that angle \(AXB\) is 2.498 radians, correct to 3 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 370, 920, 388]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 640, 153, 658]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 640, 479, 658]]<|/det|>
Find the perimeter of the shaded region.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 641, 920, 660]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 720, 92]]<|/det|>
The function g is defined by \(\mathrm{g}:x\mapsto 4x + a\) for \(x\in \mathbb{R}\), where \(a\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 104, 154, 121]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 103, 487, 122]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(a\) for which \(\mathrm{gf}(-1) = 3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 103, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 475, 193, 492]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 475, 863, 492]]<|/det|>
Find the possible values of \(a\) given that the equation \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}(x) = \mathrm{g}^{-1}(x)\) has two equal roots. [4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 510, 917, 528]]<|/det|>
<form>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 74, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[411, 85, 616, 265]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 280, 507, 306]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows part of the curve \(y = \frac{4}{5 - 3x}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 320, 917, 355]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label> Find the equation of the normal to the curve at the point where \(x = 1\) in the form \(y = mx + c\), where \(m\) and \(c\) are constants. <mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 774, 92]]<|/det|>
The shaded region is bounded by the curve, the coordinate axes and the line \(x = 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 104, 153, 121]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 103, 920, 138]]<|/det|>
Find, showing all necessary working, the volume obtained when this shaded region is rotated through \(360^{\circ}\) about the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 119, 920, 136]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]
